title: Post‑Reform Revival
text: GDP growth turns positive; inflation cools; reforms fill headlines. Valuations low, participation cautious.

title: Early Bull Ignition
text: Corporate profits rise modestly. Inflation stable, reforms continue. FII interest flickers; domestic sentiment guarded. Earnings surprises begin quietly.

title: Sustained Expansion Begins
text: GDP above 7%, inflation benign. Capex cycle starts; exports rise. Analysts raise targets slowly; smallcaps and cyclicals lead.

title: Post‑Election Revival
text: Growth robust, inflation manageable; policy supportive. Markets test new highs but valuations still fair; participation broadens.

title: Early Consolidation
text: GDP steady at 6–7%. Corporate balance sheets improve; credit flow returns. Inflation within target; currency stable. Markets quietly strong.

title: New Cycle Emergence
text: Growth resilient post‑shock; earnings revive; valuations reasonable. The cycle feels balanced.

title: Peak Expansion
text: Growth strong, inflation benign. Upgrades pour in; midcaps lead; everything feels ‘different this time’.

title: Pre‑Crisis Euphoria
text: GDP >8%. Crude low, bond yields falling. Liquidity everywhere — returns feel effortless.

title: Late‑Cycle Liquidity Excess
text: Global growth synchronised; central banks hint at tightening; investors ignore hints.

title: Policy Tightening Begins
text: Crude rises mildly; inflation nudges; policy normalisation. Debt looks interesting again.

title: Late Bull Complacency
text: GDP still >7%, but bond yields spike; growth plateaus; valuations stretched.

title: Post‑Rebound Overconfidence
text: Corporate earnings flatten; liquidity still high; leadership narrows.

title: Tightening & Rotation
text: Growth firm but profit growth slows; global yields rise; cost of capital increases; markets feel heavy.

title: End‑of‑Expansion Transition
text: GDP moderates; defensives lead; new highs rare; debt regains appeal.

title: Early Slowdown
text: Growth near 8%, but input costs rising; margins tighten; rates inch up; sentiment still cheerful.

title: Liquidity Stress
text: Credit markets fragile; NBFC misses repayment; liquidity thins; short rates spike.

title: Transition to Recovery
text: Growth bottoms; policy easing begins; valuations reasonable; confidence returns slowly.

title: Tech Bust & Credit Stress
text: Growth slips under 5%; leverage high; defaults rise; markets down 25%; no one wants to call a bottom.

title: Global Financial Crisis
text: GDP contracts; credit freezes; valuations cheapest in years; liquidity vanishes — courage most valuable.

title: Early Rebound
text: Growth still weak but stabilising; policy support builds; liquidity floods the system; disbelief lingers.

title: Post‑Crisis Liquidity Recovery
text: Cases fall; restrictions ease; liquidity abundant; earnings upgrades resume; risk appetite returns fast.
